### [EZ 899-231988: Beaver Creek POE Paving Contract](http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/16111431)

#### Official Tender Announcement

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) has issued an invitation to qualify for the Beaver Creek Point of Entry (POE) paving project, EZ 899-231988.

#### Project Description

This contract involves principal works to be executed at the Beaver Creek Border Crossing and a Residential Development Site. The Contractor shall supply all materials, labor, and plant needed for the project.

Key services and deliverables include:

- Repairing road surfaces at the Beaver Creek Border Crossing
- Cleaning existing pavement and removing existing pavement markings
- Painting pavement markings as indicated on the Contract Drawings
- Replacing the concrete wheelchair ramp for the sidewalk
- Repairing curbs near the existing fuel tank
- Conducting work to minimize access and service impacts to Border Crossing facility operations
- Upgrading ditches, culverts, and drainage systems at the Residential Development Site
- Diversion of materials from landfill to be maximized

#### Contract Details

* Contract Reference Number: WS 398 381 1385
* Solicitation Number: WS 398 381 1385
* Publication Date: April 26, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: May 10, 2023, 14:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: June 14, 2023
* Expected Contract End Date: August 9, 2023

#### Contact Information

Should you have any questions or require further clarification, please contact Simon Leung of PSPC/PW (SPAC):

simon.leung@tspgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

**Tender Documents and Submissions**
This tender process is subject to the Invitation to Qualify criteria outlined in the tender documents. Interested contractors are invited to submit qualified bidders’ forms to PSPC/PW. Only qualified bidders will be invited to submit a tender proposal.

**Ineligibility Status**

PSPC/PW reserves the right to initiate or take any actions to recover defective services and request buyer property. Ineligible companies will be given proper collaborate with responsible entities involved in winning delivery inhibiting plans.
